src: Assicuratevi che la mano sia quanto più possibile rilassata mentre eseguite le note correttamente e provate anche a non fare movimenti non necessari con le dita. Così potrete stancarvi solo il minimo indispensabile. Non dimenticate che per aumentare il volume non occorre premere i tasti con molta forza come avviene per il pianoforte. Sulla fisarmonica, per aumentare il volume, è sufficiente esercitare una pressione e una velocità maggiori sul mantice.
mt: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while playing the notes correctly and try not to make unnecessary movements with your fingers. This way you will tire only the minimum necessary. Remember that to increase the volume it is not necessary to press the keys with a lot of force as it happens on the piano. On the harmonica, to increase the volume, it is sufficient to exercise a greater pressure and speed on the reed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Quando si cerca di convertire un film in formato DVD, uno degli inconvenienti più comuni è l’overscan. In generale, i televisori sono fatti per soddisfare i gusti del pubblico. È per questa ragione che tutte le immagini che vediamo sul televisore avevano i bordi superiori, inferiori e laterali tagliati. Questo viene eseguito per assicurare che l'immagine copra interamente lo schermo e prende il nome di overscan. Purtroppo, quando si realizza un DVD, con ogni probabilità anche i suoi bordi saranno tagliati e, se nel video c'erano sottotitoli posizionati troppo vicini alla parte inferiore, essi non verranno mostrati completamente.
mt: When converting a film to DVD format, one of the most common problems is overscan. In general, televisions are made to satisfy the public. This is why all images we see on the television have their upper, lower, and side edges cut off. This is done to ensure that the image covers the entire screen and is called overscan. Unfortunately, when creating a DVD, its edges are likely to be cut off as well, and if the video had subtitles positioned too close to the bottom, they will not be shown completely.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Il piano americano consisteva nel lanciare attacchi coordinati da tre differenti direzioni. Per impedire l'arrivo di eventuali rinforzi, il generale John Cadwalder avrebbe sferrato un attacco diversivo contro le truppe britanniche a Bordentown. Il generale James Ewing avrebbe condotto 700 miliziani attraverso il fiume nei pressi di Trenton Ferry, per assumere poi il controllo del ponte sul torrente Assunpink e impedire la fuga alle truppe nemiche. La forza d'assalto principale, composta da 2.400 uomini, avrebbe attraversato il fiume nove miglia a nord di Trenton, per poi dividersi in due gruppi, uno comandato da Greene e l'altro da Sullivan, e sferrare un'offensiva prima dell'alba.
mt: The American plan was to launch coordinated attacks from three different directions. To prevent the arrival of reinforcements, General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British troops at Bordentown. General James Ewing would lead 700 militia across the river near Trenton Ferry, to take control of the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent the enemy's escape. The main assault force, consisting of 2,400 men, would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, then split into two groups, one led by Greene and the other by Sullivan, and launch an attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: "Dopo che il Congresso la adottò il 4 luglio, una bozza manoscritta firmata dal Presidente del Congresso John Hancock e dal segretario Charles Thomson fu poi inviata alla tipografia di John Dunlap a pochi isolati di distanza. Nella notte furono prodotte tra le 150 e le 200 copie, oggi note con il nome di ""I manifesti di Dunlap"". Il documento venne letto pubblicamente per la prima volta l'8 luglio nel cortile dell'Independence Hall e l'incarico fu affidato a John Nixon. Una fu spedita a George Washington il 6 luglio, che la fece leggere alle sue truppe di stanza a New York il 9 luglio, mentre una copia giunse a Londra il 10 agosto. Le 25 bordate di Dunlap tuttora note sono le copie esistenti più antiche del documento. Il manoscritto originale è andato perduto."
mt: "After the Congress adopted it on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by Congress President John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent to John Dunlap's print shop a few blocks away. In the night, between 150 and 200 copies were produced, today known as the "Dunlap broadsides". The document was read publicly for the first time on July 8 in the courtyard of Independence Hall and the task was given to John Nixon. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops stationed in New York on July 9, while a copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known are the oldest existing copies of the document. The original manuscript is lost."
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Anche i coloni, avendo notato questa attività, avevano chiamato i rinforzi. Tra le truppe che hanno potenziato le posizioni avanzate vi erano il 1° e il 3° reggimento del New Hampshire composto da 200 uomini, sotto il comando dei colonnelli John Stark e James Reed (entrambi divenuti in seguito generali). Gli uomini di Stark presero posizione lungo la difesa sul lato nord della postazione dei coloni. Quando la bassa marea aprì un varco lungo il fiume Mystic a nord-est della penisola, estesero rapidamente le difese grazie ad un piccolo muro in pietra verso nord, che terminava sulla riva di una piccola spiaggia. Gridley o Stark piantarono un palo a circa 100 piedi (30 m) dalla recinzione, dando l'ordine di non sparare fino a che i regolari non lo avessero superato.
mt: The colonists, having noticed this activity, called for reinforcements. Among the troops that strengthened the advanced positions were the 1st and 3rd regiments of the New Hampshire, composed of 200 men, under the command of Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both of whom later became generals). Stark's men took position along the north defense of the colonists' position. When the low tide opened a channel along the Mystic River to the north-east of the peninsula, they rapidly extended the defenses with a small stone wall to the north, which ended on the shore of a small beach. Gridley or Stark planted a pole about 100 feet (30 m) from the fence, giving the order not to fire until the regulars had passed it.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Nell'antica Cina i diversi periodi di tempo erano indicati in modo molto singolare: ogni periodo della Cina o ogni famiglia che era al potere costituiva una dinastia specifica. Anche gli intervalli tra le singole dinastie furono caratterizzati da periodi di instabilità e divisione tra le province. Il più noto fu il cosiddetto periodo dei Tre Regni, tra la dinastia Han e la dinastia Jin, che durò per 60 anni. In questi periodi, tra molti nobili in lotta per il trono si accesero guerre feroci. Il periodo dei Tre Regni fu una delle epoche più violente nella storia dell'antica Cina. Migliaia di persone morirono combattendo per aggiudicarsi un posto d'onore nell'imponente palazzo di Xi'an.
mt: In ancient China, different periods of time were indicated in a very peculiar way: each period of China or each family that was in power constituted a specific dynasty. Even the intervals between the individual dynasties were characterized by periods of instability and division between the provinces. The most famous was the so-called period of the Three Kingdoms, between the Han dynasty and the Jin dynasty, which lasted for 60 years. In these periods, among many nobles fighting for the throne, fierce wars broke out. The period of the Three Kingdoms was one of the most violent periods in the history of ancient China. Thousands of people died fighting to secure a place of honor in the imposing palace of Xi'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Inoltre, le colonie di formiche legionarie marciano e nidificano in fasi diverse. Nella fase nomade, durante la notte le formiche legionarie marciano, per poi accamparsi di giorno. La colonia entra in una fase nomade in seguito alla diminuzione di cibo. Durante questa fase, la colonia realizza dei nidi temporanei che vengono cambiati ogni giorno. Ognuna di queste marce o furie nomadi dura all'incirca 17 giorni.
mt: In addition, the legionary ant colonies march and nest in different phases. In the nomadic phase, at night the legionary ants march, then camp during the day. The colony enters a nomadic phase after food decreases. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed every day. Each of these marches or nomadic furies last about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: In molti hanno osservato che i ritmi fisiologici e il comportamento dipendono in maniera determinante dalla presenza di cicli endogeni e dalla loro produzione tramite gli orologi biologici. Sono stati documentati ritmi periodici, che non sono solamente delle reazioni a segnali periodici esterni, relativamente a gran parte degli esseri viventi, inclusi batteri, funghi, piante e animali. Gli orologi biologici sono degli oscillatori indipendenti, il cui ciclo libero prosegue per un periodo di tempo anche in assenza di stimoli esterni.
mt: Many have observed that physiological rhythms and behavior depend in a decisive way on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not merely reactions to external periodic signals, have been documented for most living things, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are independent oscillators, whose free-running cycle continues for a period of time even in the absence of external stimuli.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Una popolazione è costituita dall'insieme degli organismi di una data specie all'interno di un'area geografica specifica. Quando tutti gli individui di una popolazione sono identici dal punto di vista di uno specifico tratto fenotipico, si dice che sono monomorfici. Gli individui che hanno diverse varianti di uno specifico tratto sono definiti polimorfici.
mt: A population is the set of individuals of a given species within a specific geographic area. When all individuals of a population are identical in terms of a specific phenotypic trait, they are said to be monomorphic. Individuals that have different variants of a specific trait are defined as polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Il turismo naturalistico richiama le persone interessate alla visita delle aree naturali con lo scopo di godersi il paesaggio, compresa la flora e la fauna selvatica. Tra gli esempi di attività da fare sul posto ci sono caccia, pesca, fotografia, birdwatching, visite ai parchi e lo studio delle informazioni riguardanti l'ecosistema. Per esempio visitando, fotografando e imparando a conoscere gli orango del Borneo.
mt: Naturalist tourism is the practice of visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including the flora and fauna. Examples of activities include hunting, fishing, photography, birdwatching, park visits, and studying information about the ecosystem. For example, visiting, photographing, and learning about orangutans of Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Tutte le mattine, le persone lasciano i piccoli paesi di campagna per recarsi in auto al lavoro, incrociando altre persone il cui luogo di lavoro è il posto da cui sono appena partiti. In questo dinamico andirivieni, tutti sono in qualche modo collegati a un sistema di trasporto basato sulle auto private, che al tempo stesso supportano. Oggi la scienza rivela che questa massiccia economia basata sul carbonio ha costretto la biosfera al di fuori di una delle sue condizioni di stabilità che ha permesso l'evoluzione umana negli ultimi due milioni di anni.
mt: Every morning, people leave small rural communities to drive to work, crossing paths with others who are going to the place they just left. In this dynamic back-and-forth, everyone is somehow connected to a car-based transportation system that supports it. Today, science reveals that this massive carbon-based economy has forced the biosphere outside of one of its stability conditions that allowed human evolution over the last two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Possiamo considerare l'atomo come uno dei mattoni essenziali che costituiscono la materia. Si tratta di un'entità molto complessa costituita, secondo il modello semplificato di Bohr, da un nucleo centrale sulla cui orbita ruotano degli elettroni, un po' come i pianeti che orbitano intorno al sole, si veda la Figura 1.1. Il nucleo è formato da due tipi di particelle: i neutroni e i protoni. I protoni hanno carica elettrica positiva, i neutroni invece sono privi di carica. Gli elettroni sono caratterizzati da carica elettrica negativa.
mt: We can consider the atom as one of the essential bricks that constitute matter. It is a very complex entity, according to the simplified model of Bohr, consisting of a central nucleus on whose orbit electrons rotate, a bit like the planets that orbit around the sun, see Figure 1.1. The nucleus is made up of two types of particles: neutrons and protons. Protons have positive electric charge, neutrons, on the other hand, are chargeless. Electrons are characterized by negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: In definitiva, la manipolazione di informazioni codificate sotto forma di numeri binari è alla base di tutti i computer utilizzati attualmente. Un numero binario può avere solo uno dei due valori, ovvero 0 o 1, e nel linguaggio tecnico informatico questi numeri sono chiamati cifre binarie o bit.
mt: In the end, the manipulation of information encoded in the form of binary numbers is at the base of all computers currently used. A binary number can have only one of two values, either 0 or 1, and in the technical language of computer science these numbers are called binary digits or bits.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: "I blog possono inoltre contribuire a migliorare la scrittura degli studenti. Spesso, infatti, le loro prime esperienze con i blog sono contraddistinte da una grammatica e un'ortografia poco curate, ma in genere la presenza di un pubblico cambia le cose. Dal momento che gli studenti sono di solito il pubblico più critico, per evitare giudizi negativi l'autore del blog si impegna a migliorare la scrittura. I blog inoltre ""costringono gli studenti a diventare più consapevoli del momento che li circonda"". L'esigenza di alimentare l'interesse del pubblico motiva gli studenti a essere ingegnosi e interessanti (Toto, 2004). Il blog è uno strumento che si prefigge di incoraggiare la collaborazione e sviluppare l'apprendimento degli studenti ben oltre la giornata scolastica normale. L'uso corretto dei blog ""può aiutare gli studenti a diventare più critici e analitici. Rispondendo attivamente ai materiali di Internet, gli studenti possono definire la propria posizione all'interno degli scritti degli altri, oltre a delineare le proprie prospettive su specifiche questioni"" (Oravec, 2002)."
mt: "Blogs can also help improve students' writing. Often, their first experiences with blogs are characterized by poor grammar and spelling, but usually the presence of an audience changes things. Since students are often the most critical audience, to avoid negative judgments, the blog author will work to improve his or her writing. Blogs also ""force students to become more aware of the moment around them"". The need to feed the interest of the audience motivates students to be ingenious and interesting (Toto, 2004). The blog is a tool that aims to encourage collaboration and develop student learning well beyond the normal school day. Correct use of blogs ""can help students become more critical and analytical. By actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their position within the writings of others, as well as delineate their perspectives on specific issues"" (Oravec, 2002)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: La comunicazione asincrona promuove il tempo per la riflessione e la reazione agli altri. Permette agli studenti di adattare le attività al proprio ritmo e di gestire la velocità delle informazioni didattiche. Ci sono inoltre meno vincoli di tempo e questo rende gli orari di lavoro più flessibili. (Bremer, 1998) Grazie all’uso di Internet e del World Wide Web, gli studenti possono accedere alle informazioni in qualsiasi momento. Gli studenti possono anche inviare ai docenti delle domande in qualsiasi momento della giornata e aspettarsi risposte in tempi discretamente rapidi, anziché attendere fino al successivo incontro di persona.
mt: Asynchronous communication promotes time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students to adapt activities to their own pace and manage the speed of instructional information. There are also fewer time constraints and this makes work schedules more flexible. (Bremer, 1998) Thanks to the use of the Internet and the World Wide Web, students can access information at any time. Students can also send questions to instructors at any time of the day and expect responses in reasonably quick time, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Da secoli il tipico castello medievale stimola l'immaginazione, evocando scene di giostre, banchetti e cavalieri di Re Artù. È facile, anche trovandosi tra rovine millenarie, che ritornino alla mente i suoni e gli odori di lontane battaglie, percepire quasi il rumore degli zoccoli sui ciottoli e annusare la paura che proviene dalle prigioni. Ma la nostra immaginazione si basa sulla realtà? Prima di tutto, perché sono stati costruiti i castelli? In che modo sono stati progettati ed edificati?
mt: For centuries the typical medieval castle has stimulated the imagination, evoking scenes of jousts, banquets and knights of King Arthur. It is easy, even among ancient ruins, that the sounds and smells of distant battles return to mind, almost hearing the sound of hooves on cobblestones and smelling the fear that comes from the prisons. But our imagination is based on reality? First of all, why were the castles built? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Il castello di Kirby Muxloe, esempio caratteristico di questo periodo, rappresenta una casa fortificata più che un vero e proprio castello. Le sue grandi vetrate e i muri sottili non avrebbero potuto resistere a lungo a un attacco risoluto. Negli anni a partire dal 1480, quando Lord Hastings ne iniziò la costruzione, il paese era relativamente pacifico e la difesa necessaria era solo quella contro le piccole bande di predoni nomadi.
mt: Kirby Muxloe Castle, a typical example of this period, is more a fortified house than a true castle. Its large windows and thin walls would not have lasted long against a determined attack. In the years after 1480, when Lord Hastings began its construction, the country was relatively peaceful and the necessary defense was only against small bands of nomadic marauders.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Passando dal quarto di miglio al mezzo miglio, la velocità diventa molto meno importante, mentre la resistenza diventa una vera e propria necessità. Certamente, un podista che vuole affrontare una gara di mezzo miglio ad un certo livello, un uomo che sia in grado di battere i due minuti, deve essere dotato di una notevole dose di velocità, ma sopra ogni cosa è la resistenza che deve essere allenata. La preparazione più adatta per la stagione di corsa prevede durante l'inverno un po' di corsa campestre associata ad un allenamento in palestra specifico per la parte superiore del corpo.
mt: From the quarter mile to the half mile, speed becomes less important, while endurance becomes a real necessity. Certainly, a runner who wants to compete in a half mile race at a certain level, a man who is capable of beating two minutes, must be endowed with a considerable dose of speed, but above all it is endurance that must be trained. The most suitable preparation for the racing season predicts during the winter a little cross-country running associated with a specific gym training for the upper body.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Le sole pratiche nutrizionali corrette non bastano a generare elevate prestazioni, possono tuttavia avere notevoli ripercussioni sul benessere generale dei giovani atleti. Mantenere un salutare bilancio energetico, abituarsi a una corretta idratazione e comprendere i vari aspetti delle pratiche di integrazione può aiutare gli atleti a migliorare le loro prestazioni, oltre ad aumentare il piacere di praticare sport.
mt: Correct nutrition practices alone are not enough to generate high performance, but they can have significant repercussions on the overall well-being of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, getting used to proper hydration and understanding the various aspects of integration practices can help athletes improve their performance, as well as increasing the pleasure of practicing sports.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: La corsa a media distanza è uno sport relativamente poco costoso. Tuttavia, ci sono delle convinzioni errate riguardo al poco equipaggiamento necessario per partecipare. I prodotti possono essere acquistati all'occorrenza, ma la maggior parte di questi avrà un impatto esiguo o nullo sulle prestazioni. Gli atleti potrebbero preferire un prodotto anche quando non offre nessun reale beneficio.
mt: The long-distance run is a relatively inexpensive sport. However, there are some misconceptions about the little equipment needed to participate. Products can be purchased on the fly, but most of these will have little or no impact on performance. Athletes may prefer a product even when it offers no real benefit.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. src: "Il fenomeno fisico noto come risonanza magnetica nucleare (RMN), scoperto negli anni '30 da Felix Bloch (dell'Università di Stanford) e da Edward Purcell (dell'Università di Harvard) è alla base della risonanza magnetica. In questa risonanza, per effetto del campo magnetico e delle onde radio gli atomi emettono dei deboli segnali radio. Nel 1970, il medico e ricercatore scientifico Raymond Damadian, gettò le basi per l'utilizzo della risonanza magnetica per immagini come strumento per realizzare diagnosi mediche. Quattro anni più tardi ottenne il primo brevetto al mondo nel campo della risonanza magnetica. Nel 1977, il dott. Damadian portò a termine la costruzione del primo scanner per la risonanza magnetica ""integrale"", che chiamò ""Indomitable"" (""Indomabile"")."
mt: "The physical phenomenon known as nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (of Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (of Harvard University), is the basis of magnetic resonance. In this resonance, due to the magnetic field and radio waves atoms emit weak radio signals. In 1970, the physician and scientific researcher Raymond Damadian, laid the foundations for the use of magnetic resonance for images as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later he obtained the first patent in the world in the field of magnetic resonance. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first scanner for magnetic resonance ""integral"", which he called ""Indomitable""."
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Gli esseri umani sono la specie di gran lunga più dotata nel leggere la mente altrui. Questo vuol dire che riusciamo a prevedere in modo corretto quelle che altri umani percepiscono, intendono, pensano, sanno o desiderano. Fondamentale tra queste abilità è quella di comprendere le intenzioni altrui, che ci permette di risolvere possibili ambiguità del comportamento fisico. Per esempio, se vi capita di vedere una persona che rompe il finestrino di un’auto, è facile dare per scontato che stia cercando di rubare l’auto di uno sconosciuto. Se avesse perso le chiavi dell’auto e stesse cercando di scassinare la sua stessa auto, dovrebbe essere giudicato in modo diverso.
mt: Humans are by far the most skilled species at reading minds. This means that we can correctly predict what others perceive, intend, think, know, or desire. Fundamental among these abilities is the ability to understand others’ intentions, which allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical behavior. For example, if you see someone breaking the window of a car, it is easy to assume that he is trying to steal an unknown person’s car. If he had lost the keys to his own car and was trying to break into it, he should be judged differently.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Nonostante abbia una forte connotazione fantascientifica, l'IA rappresenta una branca dell'informatica molto importante che si occupa di comportamento, apprendimento e adattamento intelligente delle macchine. Le ricerche sull'IA includono la realizzazione di macchine per automatizzare operazioni che richiedono un comportamento intelligente. Alcuni esempi di applicazione sono il controllo, la pianificazione e la programmazione, la capacità di rispondere alle diagnosi e alle domande dei clienti, così come il riconoscimento della scrittura, vocale e facciale. Queste cose sono diventate discipline distinte, che si focalizzano sul fornire soluzioni ai problemi reali. Il sistema IA è oggi spesso utilizzato in campo economico, medico, ingegneristico e militare, oltre a essere integrato in diverse applicazioni software per computer domestici e videogiochi.
mt: Despite its strong science fiction connotations, AI is an important branch of computer science that deals with intelligent behavior, learning, and adaptation. AI research includes the creation of machines that can perform tasks that require intelligence when performed by humans. Examples of applications are control, planning, and scheduling, the ability to respond to diagnoses and customer questions, as well as handwriting, voice, and facial recognition. These have become distinct disciplines, focusing on providing solutions to real problems. The AI system is today often used in the economic, medical, engineering, and military fields, as well as being integrated into various software applications for home computers and video games.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. src: Gli schemi di pensiero convergenti sono tecniche di risoluzione dei problemi: esse combinano idee o ambiti diversi per giungere a una soluzione. Questo tipo di pensiero enfatizza la velocità, la logica e l'accuratezza, concentrandosi anche sul riconoscimento dei fatti, sulla riapplicazione di tecniche esistenti e sulla raccolta di informazioni. Le persone dotate di questo tipo di pensiero possiedono un pensiero logico, sono capaci di memorizzare schemi, sono in grado di risolvere problemi e possono lavorare su test scientifici.

src: "L'uso della registrazione video ha permesso di giungere a scoperte significative nell'interpretazione delle microespressioni, che sono movimenti facciali della durata di pochi millisecondi. Nello specifico, si sostiene che è possibile scoprire se una persona sta mentendo interpretando le microespressioni in modo corretto. Nel suo saggio ""Il discorso del Presidente"", Oliver Sacks ha illustrato come persone incapaci di comprendere il linguaggio parlato a causa di danni cerebrali siano tuttavia in grado di valutare con precisione la sincerità. Sostiene addirittura che tali abilità nell’interpretare il comportamento umano possano essere condivise con gli animali, come ad esempio i cani domestici."
mt: "The use of video recording has allowed significant discoveries in the interpretation of microexpressions, which are facial movements lasting only a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that it is possible to discover whether a person is lying by correctly interpreting microexpressions. In his essay "The President's Speech", Oliver Sacks illustrated how people incapable of understanding spoken language due to brain damage are nevertheless able to accurately assess sincerity. He even claims that such abilities in interpreting human behavior can be shared with animals, such as domestic dogs."
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Dato il cambiamento nella capacità di acquisire conoscenza e di apprendere, così come menzionato sopra, si è modificata anche la velocità di base alla quale veniva acquisita la conoscenza. Il modo di ricevere le informazioni era cambiato. Il punto non era più la memoria individuale; l'attenzione era concentrata sulla capacità di ricordare il testo. In pratica, il Rinascimento ha modificato significativamente l'approccio all'apprendimento e alla divulgazione della conoscenza.
mt: Given the change in the speed at which knowledge was acquired and learned, as mentioned above, the way of receiving information was also changed. The point was no longer individual memory; attention was focused on the ability to remember the text. In practice, the Renaissance significantly changed the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: "Internet riunisce in sé alcuni elementi sia della comunicazione di massa, sia della comunicazione interpersonale. Gli elementi caratteristici di Internet portano a dimensioni supplementari in termini di teoria degli usi e delle gratificazioni. Per esempio, come importanti motivazioni per l’uso di Internet si suggeriscono ""l’apprendimento"" e la ""socializzazione"" (James et al., 1995). Lo studio di Eighmey e McCord (1998) sulle reazioni del pubblico ai siti web ha identificato due nuovi aspetti della motivazione, ovvero il ""coinvolgimento personale"" e le ""relazioni continue""."
mt: "Internet combines some elements of both mass communication and interpersonal communication. The characteristic elements of Internet bring additional dimensions in terms of uses and gratifications theory. For example, as important motivations for Internet use are suggested "learning" and "socialization" (James et al., 1995). The study of Eighmey and McCord (1998) on public reactions to web sites has identified two new aspects of motivation, namely "personal involvement" and "continuing relationships"."
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Il punto più alto dello stile gotico fu toccato nel periodo compreso tra il X e l'XI secolo e nel XIV secolo. Inizialmente l'abbigliamento subiva la forte influenza della cultura bizantina dell'est. Ma la lentezza delle vie di comunicazione fa sì che la diffusione degli stili in occidente possa ritardare di 25-30 anni. verso la fine del Medioevo l’Europa occidentale cominciò a sviluppare un proprio stile. Uno degli sviluppi più significativi dell’epoca, risultato delle crociate, fu l’introduzione dei bottoni per allacciare i vestiti.
mt: The highest point of the Gothic style was reached between the 10th and 11th centuries and the 14th century. Initially the clothing was strongly influenced by the Byzantine culture of the East. But the slowness of the communication routes means that the spread of styles in the West can delay by 25-30 years. towards the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the most significant developments of the period, the result of the Crusades, was the introduction of buttons to fasten clothes.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Per cercare di mitigare in qualche misura le sofferenze future possiamo iniziare ad adottare stili di vita più rispettosi dell'ambiente, possiamo aderire al movimento ambientalista e anche fare attivismo. In molti casi questo funziona solo come un trattamento sintomatico. Se invece non vogliamo solo una soluzione temporanea, dovremmo trovare la causa ultima dei problemi e disattivarla. È abbastanza evidente che il mondo è molto cambiato per via dei progressi scientifici e tecnologici dell'umanità, mentre i problemi sono aumentati a causa del sovrappopolamento e dello stravagante stile di vita degli esseri umani.
mt: To try to mitigate future suffering we can start adopting more environmentally friendly lifestyles, we can join the environmental movement and even activism. In many cases this only works as a symptomatic treatment. If we don't want just a temporary solution, we should find the ultimate cause of the problems and disable it. It is quite evident that the world has changed due to scientific and technological progress of humanity, while the problems have increased due to overpopulation and the extravagant lifestyle of humans.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: "L'equilibrio dei poteri era un sistema in base al quale le nazioni europee si impegnavano a mantenere la sovranità nazionale di ogni Stato europeo. Il concetto prevedeva che tutte le nazioni europee si impegnassero per impedire a una nazione di raggiungere l'egemonia; per questo i governi nazionali modificavano spesso le loro alleanze al fine di mantenere l'equilibrio. La guerra di successione spagnola fu la prima centrata sulla questione dell'equilibrio del potere. Questo ha segnato un cambiamento cruciale: le potenze europee, infatti, non avrebbero più avuto il pretesto delle guerre di religione. Per questo motivo, l'ultima guerra ad essere definita ""di religione"" è stata la Guerra dei Trent'anni."
mt: "The Balance of Power was a system in which European nations agreed to maintain the sovereignty of every European state. The concept was that all European nations would agree to prevent any nation from achieving hegemony; for this reason, national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of the Spanish Succession was the first centered on the issue of the balance of power. This marked a crucial change: European powers would no longer have the pretext of religious wars. For this reason, the last war to be called "of religion" was the Thirty Years' War."
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: In questa fase della storia europea, la Chiesa cattolica, divenuta ricca e potente, si titrovò ad essere sotto esame. La religione cristiana aveva agito da collante tra gli Stati europei per oltre mille anni, nonostante le differenze linguistiche e di costume. Il suo potere onnipresente ha influenzato chiunque, dal re ai cittadini comuni. Uno dei fondamenti del cristianesimo è che la ricchezza deve servire per alleviare la sofferenza e la povertà e che le riserve monetarie della chiesa esistano proprio per questo motivo. L’autorità centrale della chiesa è rimasta a Roma per oltre mille anni e questa convergenza di potere e di denaro ha spinto molti a chiedersi se questo principio sia stato rispettato.
mt: At this point in European history, the Catholic Church, having become rich and powerful, was under scrutiny. Christianity had acted as a glue between European states for over a thousand years, despite linguistic and cultural differences. Its omnipresent power had influenced everyone, from kings to common citizens. One of the foundations of Christianity is that wealth should serve to alleviate suffering and poverty, and that the church's monetary reserves exist for this purpose. The central authority of the church had remained in Rome for over a thousand years, and this convergence of power and money had led many to wonder if this principle had been respected.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Il 6 ottobre 1789, una folla di donne del mercato costrinse re Luigi XVI, in preda al terrore, a lasciare Versailles per tornare a Parigi, insieme alla regina Maria Antonietta, ai loro due figli piccoli (Maria Teresa di 11 anni e Luigi Carlo di 4 anni) e ad Elisabetta, la sorella del re. Con una carrozza fecero ritorno a Parigi, attorniati da una folla di persone che gridavano e urlavano minacce contro i sovrani. La folla costrinse il re e la regina a tenere spalancati i finestrini della loro carrozza. Ad un certo punto qualcuno tra la folla ha mostrato alla regina terrorizzata la testa di una guardia reale che era stata uccisa a Versailles.
mt: 6 October 1789, a mob of market women forced King Louis XVI, in terror, to leave Versailles to return to Paris, along with Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young children (Maria Theresa, 11, and Louis Charles, 4) and Elizabeth, the king's sister. With a carriage they returned to Paris, surrounded by a crowd of people who were shouting and threatening the sovereigns. The crowd forced the king and queen to keep the windows of their carriage open. At one point someone in the crowd showed the terrified queen the head of a royal guard who had been killed at Versailles.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Poco dopo l'inizio delle ostilità, la Gran Bretagna decise di attuare un blocco navale nei confronti della Germania. La strategia si è rivelata efficace: prevedeva l'interruzione di qualsiasi fornitura militare e civile essenziale, nonostante questo blocco violasse il diritto internazionale solitamente accolto e codificato da molteplici trattati internazionali degli ultimi due secoli. La Gran Bretagna minò le acque internazionali per impedire l'accesso di qualsiasi imbarcazione a intere sezioni dell'oceano, mettendo a rischio anche le navi neutrali. Poiché questa tattica aveva suscitato una risposta limitata, la Germania si aspettava una reazione simile alla sua campagna di guerra sottomarina indiscriminata.
mt: Shortly after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain decided to implement a naval blockade against Germany. The strategy proved effective: it involved the interruption of any essential military or civilian supplies, despite this blockade violating the international law usually accepted and codified by numerous international treaties of the last two centuries. Since this tactic had elicited a limited response, Germany expected a similar reaction to its indiscriminate submarine warfare campaign.

src: Negli Stati Uniti d'America la sclerosi multipla (SM) fa registrare circa 400.000 casi noti, collocandosi al primo posto tra le malattie neurologiche che colpiscono i giovani e gli adulti di mezza età. La SM è una patologia che colpisce il sistema nervoso centrale, di cui fanno parte cervello, midollo spinale e nervo ottico. La ricerca ha evidenziato che le probabilità di sviluppare la SM tra le femmine sono doppie rispetto ai maschi.
mt: 400,000 cases of multiple sclerosis (MS) are known in the United States, making it the most common neurological disease affecting young and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which includes the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerve. Research has shown that the chances of developing MS are twice as high for women as for men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Lo studio ha rivelato che depressione, paura e catastrofizzazione mediavano il rapporto tra dolore e disabilità nelle persone affette da lombalgia. Gli effetti della catastrofizzazione sono gli unici ad essere condizionati da sessioni settimanali strutturate di attività fisica, non la depressione e la paura. Chi partecipa ad attività regolari ha avuto bisogno di un maggior sostegno, in termini di percezione negativa del dolore, a distinguere le differenze tra il dolore cronico e la sensazione di disagio dovuta al normale movimento fisico.
mt: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophizing mediated the relationship between pain and disability in people with low back pain. The effects of catastrophizing were the only ones to be influenced by weekly structured physical activity sessions, not depression and fear. Those who participated in regular activity had a greater need for support, in terms of negative perception of pain, to distinguish between chronic pain and the discomfort due to normal physical movement.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: L'avvelenamento interno potrebbe non essere da subito evidente. I suoi sintomi, tra cui il vomito, sono molto generici, tanto da rendere impossibile una diagnosi immediata. La principale indicazione di avvelenamento interno potrebbe essere la presenza in casa di un contenitore di farmaci o di sostanze chimiche nocive aperto. Verificare se sull'etichetta sono presenti istruzioni di primo soccorso relative a quel veleno specifico.
mt: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Its symptoms, including vomiting, are very general, making it impossible to diagnose immediately. The main indication of internal poisoning could be the presence in the house of a container of drugs or harmful chemicals open. Check if the label has first aid instructions for that specific poison.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Gli effetti sociali e politici sono numerosi, fra questi si possono citare l'uso del sistema metrico, il passaggio dall'assolutismo alla repubblica, il nazionalismo e il convincimento che la nazione appartiene al popolo e non è di proprietà di un unico sovrano. Inoltre, dopo la Rivoluzione le professioni erano aperte a tutti i candidati uomini, consentendo ai più ambiziosi e fortunati di avere successo. Lo stesso vale per i militari, dal momento che le classifiche dell’esercito, invece di essere basate sulla classe, ora si basano sul calibro. La Rivoluzione francese è stata una fonte di ispirazione anche per molti altri lavoratori oppressi di vari Paesi per iniziare la propria rivoluzione.
mt: The social and political effects are numerous, including the adoption of the metric system, the transition from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism, and the belief that the nation belongs to the people and not to a single sovereign. Furthermore, after the Revolution, professions were open to all male candidates, allowing the most ambitious and fortunate to succeed. The same is true for the military, as the army's ranks are now based on caliber rather than class. The French Revolution was also a source of inspiration for many other oppressed workers in various countries to begin their own revolution.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Ogni persona partecipa alla vita sociale e usa i sistemi di trasporto, di cui quasi tutti si lamentano. src: "Il ""Traffic Flow"" (ovvero ""flusso del traffico"") è lo studio del movimento dei singoli conducenti e dei veicoli da un punto all’altro e delle interazioni che essi generano l’uno con l’altro. Purtroppo, lo studio del flusso di traffico è complesso poiché il comportamento dei conducenti non può essere previsto con una certezza assoluta. Per fortuna, il comportamento dei conducenti tende a rientrare in un range ragionevolmente costante, quindi, a loro volta, i flussi di traffico tendono a mostrare una ragionevole costanza e possono essere rappresentati genericamente in modo matematico. Per ottenere una rappresentazione più accurata del flusso di traffico sono state messe in correlazione le tre variabili principali: (1) portata, (2) densità e (3) velocità. Queste relazioni sono utili per pianificare, progettare e gestire le strutture viarie."
mt: "Traffic Flow" is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles from one point to another and the interactions they generate with each other. Unfortunately, the study of traffic flow is complex because the behavior of drivers cannot be predicted with absolute certainty. Fortunately, the behavior of drivers tends to fall within a reasonably constant range, so, in turn, traffic flows tend to show a reasonable consistency and can be represented generically mathematically. To obtain a more accurate representation of traffic flow, the three main variables were correlated: (1) flow, (2) density and (3) speed. These relationships are useful for planning, designing and managing road structures."
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Uno dei primi esperimenti a suggerire che il DNA fosse un materiale genetico è stato quello condotto da Hershey e Chase. Hershey e Chase usarono batteriofagi, cioè virus, per impiantare il loro stesso DNA in un batterio. Hanno eseguito due esperimenti evidenziando il DNA del batteriofago con fosforo radioattivo o la proteina del batteriofago con zolfo radioattivo.
mt: One of the first experiments to suggest that DNA was a genetic material was that conducted by Hershey and Chase. Hershey and Chase used bacteriophages, that is viruses, to implant their own DNA in a bacterium. They performed two experiments highlighting the DNA of the bacteriophage with radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the bacteriophage with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Le mutazioni possono avere una serie di effetti differenti in base al tipo di mutazione, alla rilevanza del pezzo di materiale genetico coinvolto e a seconda se le cellule interessate appartengono alla linea germinale. Le mutazioni che possono essere trasmesse ai figli sono solo quelle a livello delle cellule germinali; le mutazioni che avvengono altrove possono causare la morte delle cellule o il cancro.
mt: Mutations can have a variety of effects depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the piece of genetic material involved, and whether the affected cells are part of the germ line. Mutations that can be passed on to children are only those at the level of germ cells; mutations that occur elsewhere can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: A quanto sembra, le capre furono addomesticate per la prima volta circa 10.000 anni fa sui monti Zagros, in Iran. Iniziarono ad essere allevate dalle culture e dalle tribù dell'antichità per avere facilmente a disposizione latte, vello, carne e pelle. Le capre domestiche erano solitamente allevate in mandrie lasciate libere di muoversi sulle colline o in altre aree da pascolo, spesso accudite da caprai (simili ai pastori) che spesso erano bambini o adolescenti. Questi metodi di pastorizia sono ancora utilizzati al giorno d'oggi.
mt: 10,000 years ago, goats were first domesticated on the Zagros Mountains in Iran. They were domesticated by ancient cultures and tribes for easy access to milk, wool, meat, and skin. Domestic goats were usually raised in herds that were allowed to roam the hills or other grazing areas, often tended by shepherds (similar to shepherds) who were often children or adolescents. These methods of pastoralism are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: "Il gioco del golf consiste nel colpire le palline fino alle buche usando apposite mazze. Un turno regolare prevede diciotto buche, con i giocatori che iniziano solitamente dalla prima buca del percorso e finiscono alla diciottesima. Il giocatore vincente è quello che usa meno colpi, detti swing della mazza, per completare il percorso. Il gioco si svolge sull'erba e quella che circonda la buca, chiamata ""green"", viene tagliata più corta."
mt: "Golf is a game in which one uses special clubs to hit balls into holes. A typical round consists of eighteen holes, with players usually starting at the first hole of the course and ending at the eighteenth. The winner is the player who uses the fewest swings of the club to complete the course. The game is played on grass and the area around the hole, called the ""green"", is cut shorter."
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: L'obiettivo primario della scienza è comprendere il modo in cui funziona il mondo attraverso il metodo scientifico. Questo metodo guida di fatto la maggior parte dell'indagine scientifica. Ma non si tratta solo della sperimentazione, posto che un esperimento è un test che si usa per escludere uno o più delle possibili ipotesi; anche porre domande e fare osservazioni consente di orientare la ricerca scientifica.
mt: The primary goal of science is to understand how the world works through the scientific method. This method guides most scientific inquiry. But it's not just experimentation, since an experiment is a test used to exclude one or more of the possible hypotheses; even posing questions and making observations can guide scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: I tornado colpiscono un'area limitata rispetto ad altre tempeste violente, ma possono distruggere qualunque cosa al loro passaggio. I tornado sradicano alberi, strappano assi dagli edifici e scagliano automobili per aria. Tra i tornado più violenti, il 2% ha una durata di oltre tre ore. Durante queste mostruose tempeste, i venti possono raggiungere 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
mt: Tornadoes strike a limited area compared to other violent storms, but can destroy anything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip roofs off buildings and toss cars through the air. Among the most violent tornadoes, 2% last more than three hours. During these monstrous storms, winds can reach 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Da migliaia e migliaia di anni l'uomo costruisce e utilizza le lenti di ingrandimento. Ma i primi telescopi veri vennero creati in Europa alla fine del XVI secolo. Questi telescopi utilizzavano un insieme di due lenti per far apparire più vicini e più grandi gli oggetti più lontani.
mt: For thousands of years, humans have built and used magnifying lenses. But the first true telescopes were created in Europe at the end of the 16th century. These telescopes used a pair of lenses to make distant objects appear closer and larger.

src: "Maometto nutriva profondo interesse per le questioni che vanno al di là della vita terrena. Era solito recarsi in una grotta conosciuta come ""Hira"" sulla montagna della ""noor"" (luce) per meditare. La grotta, che è sopravvissuta al passare del tempo, offre di per sé un'immagine molto chiara della spiritualità di Maometto. La grotta poggia sulla sommità di una delle montagne a nord della Mecca, completamente distaccata dal resto del mondo. In realtà non è affatto semplice da trovare, anche se se ne conosceva l'esistenza. Una volta dentro la grotta, l'isolamento è totale. Non si vede nient'altro che un meraviglioso cielo limpido e una gran quantità di montagne intorno. Dall'interno della grotta si può vedere o sentire ben poco del mondo circostante."
mt: "Muhammad was deeply interested in matters that go beyond the earthly life. He was in the habit of going to a cave known as "Hira" on the mountain of "noor" (light) to meditate. The cave, which has survived the passage of time, offers a very clear image of Muhammad's spirituality. The cave is on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, completely detached from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not at all easy to find, even though its existence was known. Once inside the cave, the isolation is total. All that can be seen is a wonderful clear sky and a great number of mountains around. From inside the cave, little can be seen or heard of the surrounding world."
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Già nel XVI secolo in Inghilterra furono costruite le wagonway. Nonostante fossero formate semplicemente da assi in legno parallele, le wagonway, se confrontate con le strade leggermente più accidentate del periodo, permettevano ai cavalli che le percorrevano di raggiungere velocità maggiori e di spostare carichi più pesanti. Le traverse furono introdotte relativamente presto per mantenere in posizione i binari. Gradualmente, tuttavia, si comprese che i binari sarebbero stati più efficienti se avessero avuto in cima una barra di ferro. Diventò una pratica comune, anche se il ferro provocava una maggiore usura delle ruote di legno dei vagoni. Infine, le ruote in legno lasciarono il posto a quelle in ferro. Nel 1767 fecero la loro comparsa le prime rotaie completamente in ferro.
mt: 16th century wagonways in England were simply made of parallel wooden rails, but they allowed horses to travel faster and carry heavier loads than the slightly more rugged roads of the period. Cross-ties were introduced early on to keep the rails in place. Gradually, however, it was realized that rails would be more efficient if they had a steel top. It became common practice, even though steel caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels gave way to steel ones. In 1767, the first fully steel rails appeared.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.

src: Il Romanticismo fu caratterizzato da una consistente componente di determinismo culturale, tratta da autori come Goethe, Fichte e Schlegel. Nel quadro del romanticismo, la geografia ha condizionato gli individui, e nel corso del tempo sono sorti usi, costumi e cultura legati a tale geografia che, essendo in armonia con il contesto della società, sono risultati più efficaci delle leggi imposte in modo arbitrario.
mt: Romanticism was characterized by a significant component of cultural determinism, taken from authors such as Goethe, Fichte and Schlegel. In the framework of romanticism, geography has conditioned individuals, and over time have arisen customs, habits and culture linked to this geography that, being in harmony with the context of society, have resulted more effective than laws imposed arbitrarily.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: "Determinismo tecnologico è un termine che include nella pratica un ampio ventaglio di idee, dall'innovazione tecnologica o dall'imperativo tecnologico al senso stretto secondo il quale il destino dell'uomo sia mosso da una logica soggiacente, associata a leggi scientifiche e alla loro realizzazione nella tecnologia. Gran parte delle interpretazioni del determinismo tecnologico hanno in comune due idee generali: una è che lo sviluppo della tecnologia stessa segua un percorso che va molto oltre l'influenza politica e culturale, e l'altra è che la tecnologia abbia a sua volta degli ""effetti"" sulle società che sono intrinsechi, anziché condizionati socialmente. Per esempio possiamo affermare che l'automobile comporta necessariamente uno sviluppo della rete stradale. Tuttavia, una rete stradale nazionale solo per poche auto non è sostenibile economicamente, pertanto vengono sviluppati nuovi metodi di produzione per ridurre i costi legati alla proprietà di un'automobile. Il possesso di massa di automobili porta inoltre a una maggiore percentuale di incidenti sulle strade, e di conseguenza l'invenzione di nuove tecniche di soccorso per la cura delle persone ferite."
mt: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas, from technological innovation or the imperative of technology to the strict sense according to which the destiny of man is driven by an underlying logic, associated with scientific laws and their realization in technology. Much of the interpretations of technological determinism have in common two general ideas: one is that the development of technology itself follows a path that goes far beyond political and cultural influence, and the other is that technology has "effects" on societies that are intrinsic, rather than socially conditioned. For example, we can say that the car necessarily entails the development of the road network. However, a national road network for only a few cars is not economically sustainable, so new production methods are developed to reduce the costs associated with the ownership of a car. The mass ownership of cars also leads to a higher percentage of road accidents, and consequently the invention of new techniques of rescue for the care of injured people."
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: "L'indicazione ""arcata in su"" assomiglia a una V e l'indicazione ""arcata in giù"" ad una graffetta o a un quadrato privo del lato inferiore. Verso l'alto significa che si dovrebbe iniziare dalla punta e spingere l'arco, e verso il basso significa che si dovrebbe iniziare dall'alamaro (che è dove la mano sostiene l'arco) e tirare l'arco verso di sé. Un arco ascendente solitamente genera un suono più morbido, mentre con un arco discendente risulta un suono più forte e deciso. Potete decidere di aggiungere le vostre indicazioni personalizzate a matita, ma tenete presente che i segni dell'archeggio che trovate stampati hanno una valenza musicale, quindi in linea di massima andrebbero rispettati."
mt: "The indication "draw up" looks like a V and the indication "draw down" like a pencil or a square without the bottom side. Up means that you should start from the tip and push the bow, and down means that you should start from the bow (which is where the hand holds the bow) and pull the bow towards yourself. An ascending bow usually generates a softer sound, while a descending bow results in a stronger and more decisive sound. You can decide to add your own personalized indications with a pencil, but keep in mind that the bowing signs you find printed have a musical value, so in general they should be respected."
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."
