src: "Con civiltà si intende una cultura specifica, condivisa da un gruppo significativamente ampio di persone che vivono e lavorano in modo collaborativo, costituendo una società. La parola civiltà deriva dal latino ""civilis"", che vuol dire civile; il termine è a sua volta collegato con ""civis"", ossia cittadino, e ""civitas"", ossia città o città-stato, e in certo qual modo definisce quindi anche le dimensioni della società. Le città-stato sono le prime realtà ad anticipare l'idea di nazione. Cultura della civiltà significa trasmettere conoscenze attraverso più generazioni, lasciare un'impronta culturale indelebile attraverso una diffusione equa. Le culture minori spesso spariscono senza lasciare tracce storiche rilevanti, non venendo così riconosciute come civiltà vere e proprie."
mt: "Civilization is a specific culture shared by a significantly large group of people who live and work collaboratively, constituting a society. The word civilization is derived from the Latin ""civilis"", which means civil; the term is in turn connected with ""civis"", that is citizen, and ""civitas"", that is city or city-state, and in a certain way defines also the dimensions of the society. City-states are the first realities to anticipate the idea of nation. Culture of civilization means transmitting knowledge through generations, leaving an indelible cultural imprint through an equitable distribution. Minor cultures often disappear without leaving significant historical traces, not being recognized as true civilizations."
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Situato nella parte superiore del distretto di Paro (nel villaggio di Phondey), il Drukgyal Dzong è un forte in rovina, oltre che un monastero buddista. Si dice che la fortezza sia stata costruita da Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel nel 1649 per celebrare la propria vittoria sui tibetano-mongoli. Nel 1951 divampò un incendio, cui sono sopravvissute solo alcune reliquie del Drugkyal Dzong, tra cui l'immagine di Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. In seguito all'incendio, la fortezza è stata conservata e protetta e continua a essere una delle attrazioni più straordinarie del Bhutan.
mt: Located in the upper part of Paro district (in the village of Phondey), the Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress, as well as a Buddhist monastery. It is said that the fortress was built by Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel in 1649 to celebrate his victory over the Tibetan-Mongols. In 1951 a fire broke out, and only some relics of the Drugkyal Dzong survived, including the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected and continues to be one of the most extraordinary attractions of Bhutan.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: Nel corso del XVIII secolo la Cambogia si trovava stretta tra due vicini molto potenti, la Thailandia e il Vietnam. Nel XVIII secolo la Cambogia fu invasa più volte dai thailandesi, che nel 1772 distrussero la capitale Phnom Phen. Negli ultimi anni del XVIII secolo, il Paese fu invaso anche dai vietnamiti.
mt: 18th century Cambodia was sandwiched between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. In the 18th century, the Thais invaded Cambodia several times, destroying the capital Phnom Penh in 1772. In the last years of the 18th century, the country was also invaded by the Vietnamese.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: Taiwan nasce nel XV secolo, quando i marinai europei che transitavano di lì a poco registrano il nome dell'isola con il nome di Ilha Formosa, o isola meravigliosa. La Compagnia olandese delle Indie orientali nel 1624 istituisce una base nella parte sud-ovest di Taiwan, dando inizio ad una trasformazione che riguardava i sistemi di produzione dei cereali degli aborigeni e assumendo dei braccianti cinesi per lavorare nelle sue piantagioni di riso e zucchero. Nel 1683, le zone costiere occidentali e settentrionali di Taiwan finiscono sotto il controllo delle forze della dinastia Qing (1644-1912); nel 1885, Taiwan viene dichiarata provincia dell'Impero Qing. Dopo essere stato sconfitto nella prima guerra sino-giapponese (1894-1895), il governo Qing firma nel 1895 il Trattato di Shimonoseki cedendo così la sovranità di Taiwan al Giappone; l'isola rimarrà sotto il governo giapponese fino al 1945.
mt: Taiwan was born in the 15th century, when European sailors passing through recorded the name of the island as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. The Dutch East India Company in 1624 established a base in the southwest of Taiwan, beginning a transformation that involved the cereal production systems of the aborigines and hiring Chinese laborers to work in its sugar and rice plantations. In 1683, the western and northern coastal areas of Taiwan came under the control of the Qing dynasty (1644-1912); in 1885, Taiwan was declared a province of the Qing Empire. After being defeated in the first Sino-Japanese war (1894-1895), the Qing government signed in 1895 the Treaty of Shimonoseki, ceding sovereignty of Taiwan to Japan; the island remained under Japanese rule until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Si tratta del cosiddetto pH della sostanza. Usando il succo del cavolo rosso è possibile costruire un indicatore di pH. Il succo del cavolo cambia colore in base a quanto è acido o basico (alcalino) l'elemento chimico. Il livello di pH della sostanza chimica analizzata è dato dalla quantità di ioni di idrogeno presenti (la lettera H di pH). Con ioni idrogeno si intendono dei protoni cui sono stati strappati via gli elettroni (dato che gli atomi di idrogeno sono formati da un protone e da un elettrone).
mt: It is the pH of the substance. Using red cabbage juice, it is possible to build a pH indicator. The juice of red cabbage changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical element is. The pH level of the chemical being analyzed is given by the amount of hydrogen ions present (the H in pH). Hydrogen ions are protons that have had electrons stripped away (since hydrogen atoms are made up of a proton and an electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: I leoni sono i felini più sociali e vivono in gruppi numerosi chiamati branchi. I branchi sono composti da maschi adulti, solitamente 2 o 3 imparentati tra loro, e da un numero di femmine e cuccioli che può arrivare a 30. Di solito le femmine sono strettamente imparentate l'una con l'altra, essendo una famiglia numerosa di figlie e sorelle. Il branco di leoni agisce in modo molto simile al branco di lupi o di cani, il cui comportamento è infatti sorprendentemente analogo a quello dei leoni (ma non a quello di altri grandi felini), anche per quanto concerne gli attacchi mortali alle loro prede.
mt: Lions are the most social of the big cats and live in groups called prides. Prides consist of adult males, usually two or three related to each other, and a number of females and cubs that can reach 30. Usually the females are closely related to each other, being a large family of daughters and sisters. The lion pride acts in a very similar way to the wolf pack or the dog pack, whose behavior is in fact surprisingly similar to that of lions (but not to that of other big cats), even in terms of deadly attacks on their prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Al di sotto di loro ci sono altri felini di media taglia che si nutrono di prede di media taglia, che variano dai conigli alle antilopi e ai cervi. Infine, esistono molti piccoli felini (compresi i gatti domestici in libertà) che si nutrono di piccole prede, notevolmente più numerose, come insetti, roditori, lucertole e uccelli. Il concetto di nicchia costituisce il segreto del loro successo, un obiettivo particolare che ogni felino ha e che gli permette di non mettersi in competizione con gli altri.
mt: Below them are other medium-sized felids that prey on medium-sized prey, ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small felids (including feral domestic cats) that prey on small prey, notably more numerous, such as insects, rodents, lizards and birds. The concept of niche is the secret of their success, a particular target that each felid has and that allows it not to compete with others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Gli ocelotti amano nutrirsi di piccoli animali. Se possibile, vanno a caccia di scimmie, serpenti, roditori e uccelli e quasi tutte le prede che catturano sono molto più piccole di loro. Gli scienziati ritengono che gli ocelotti seguano e trovino gli animali da mangiare (prede) grazie all'olfatto, fiutando a terra dove sono stati. Grazie alla visione notturna sono in grado di vedere molto bene nel buio, oltre a essere in grado di muoversi furtivamente. Per cacciare la loro preda, gli ocelotti si mimetizzano con l'ambiente circostante per poi piombandole addosso.
mt: Ocelots like to feed on small animals. If possible, they hunt monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds and almost all the prey they catch are much smaller than them. Scientists believe that ocelots follow and find the animals they eat (prey) by smell, sniffing the ground where they have been. Thanks to their night vision they can see very well in the dark, as well as being able to move stealthily. To hunt their prey, ocelots camouflage themselves with the surrounding environment and then pounce on them.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Un atleta completo: la tigre è in grado di arrampicarsi (seppure non troppo bene), nuotare, fare salti molto lunghi ed esercitare una forza di trazione cinque volte superiore a quella di un uomo forte. La tigre appartiene alla stessa famiglia (il genere Panthera) del leone, del leopardo e del giaguaro. Questi quattro felini sono i soli a ruggire. Il ruggito della tigre non è potente come quello del leone, ma assomiglia più ad una frase di parole urlate e rabbiose.
mt: A complete athlete: the tiger is able to climb (although not very well), swim, make very long jumps and exert a pulling force five times greater than that of a strong man. The tiger belongs to the same family (the genus Panthera) of the lion, leopard and jaguar. These four felids are the only ones to roar. The roar of the tiger is not as powerful as that of the lion, but resembles more a phrase of shouted and angry words.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: "La cellula è l'unità strutturale e funzionale più piccola degli organismi (cose) viventi. Cellula deriva dalla parola latina ""cella"", che vuol dire piccola camera. Se si osservano gli esseri viventi al microscopio, è possibile notare che sono formati da piccoli quadratini o piccole sfere. Il biologo inglese Robert Hooke, con l'ausilio di un microscopio, osservò dei piccoli quadratini nel sughero. Sembravano stanze. È stato il primo ad osservare delle cellule morte"
mt: "The cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of living organisms. Cell comes from the Latin word "cella", which means small chamber. If you observe living things with a microscope, you can see that they are made up of small squares or small spheres. English biologist Robert Hooke, with the help of a microscope, observed small squares in the cork. They seemed to be rooms. He was the first to observe dead cells"
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Le piante producono l'ossigeno che viene respirato dagli esseri umani e assorbono l'anidride carbonica espulsa dagli stessi (attraverso l'espirazione). Le piante elaborano il proprio nutrimento con il sole tramite la fotosintesi. Inoltre fanno ombra. Costruiamo le nostre case a partire dalle piante e produciamo i vestiti con le piante. Gran parte del cibo che mangiamo è fatto di piante. Senza le piante gli animali non potrebbero sopravvivere.
mt: Plants produce the oxygen that humans breathe and absorb the carbon dioxide exhaled by them (through exhalation). Plants process their own food with the sun through photosynthesis. In addition they provide shade. We build our houses from plants and produce our clothes from plants. Much of the food we eat is made of plants. Without plants animals could not survive.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Quando un piccolo gruppo di esseri viventi (una piccola popolazione) si separa dalla popolazione principale alla quale appartiene (per esempio se si sposta oltre una catena montuosa o un fiume, o si sposta su una nuova isola, rendendo quindi difficile un eventuale ritorno), esso si ritroverà probabilmente in un ambiente diverso da quello in cui si trovava prima. Questo nuovo ambiente è caratterizzato da risorse e competitori diversi, quindi, per porsi come un concorrente forte, la nuova popolazione avrà bisogno di caratteristiche o trasformazioni differenti rispetto a quelle necessarie in precedenza. La popolazione originaria non è per nulla cambiata; continua ad aver bisogno degli stessi adattamenti di prima. Con il passare del tempo e man mano che la nuova popolazione si adatta al suo nuovo ambiente, assomiglia sempre di meno all'altra popolazione. A un certo punto, dopo migliaia o addirittura milioni di anni, le due popolazioni appariranno talmente diverse tra loro che non potranno più essere definite come appartenenti alla stessa specie. Questo processo, che consiste nella formazione di nuove specie, viene chiamato speciazione. La speciazione è una conseguenza inevitabile ed è un elemento fondamentale dell'evoluzione.
mt: When a small group of living things (a small population) separates from the main population to which it belongs (for example, if it moves beyond a mountain range or a river, or moves to a new island, making a return difficult), it will probably find itself in a different environment from the one it was in before. This new environment is characterized by different resources and competitors, so, in order to be a strong competitor, the new population will need different characteristics or transformations than those needed previously. The original population has not changed at all; it continues to need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population adapts to its new environment, it will always be less like the other population. At a certain point, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will appear so different from each other that they cannot be defined as belonging to the same species. This process, which consists of the formation of new species, is called speciation. Speciation is an inevitable consequence and is a fundamental element of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: L'organo principale dell'apparato circolatorio è il cuore, che si occupa di pompare il sangue. Il sangue si dirama dal cuore attraverso dei tubi denominati arterie e vi fa ritorno attraverso dei tubi denominati vene. I tubi più piccoli sono detti capillari.
mt: The heart is the main organ of the circulatory system, which pumps blood. The blood is distributed from the heart through arteries and returns through veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Gli insetti sono stati i primi animali a spiccare il volo. La capacità di volare ha consentito loro di sfuggire con più facilità ai nemici e di trovare cibo e compagni in modo più efficiente. Gran parte degli insetti è avvantaggiata dalla capacità di ripiegare le ali lungo il corpo. Ciò consente loro di sfruttare una maggiore varietà di piccoli anfratti per nascondersi dai predatori. Tra tutti gli insetti esistenti al giorno d'oggi, gli unici che non sono in grado di ripiegare le ali sono le libellule e le effimere.
mt: Insects were the first animals to fly. The ability to fly allowed them to escape predators more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects are advantaged by the ability to fold their wings along the body. This allows them to exploit a greater variety of small crevices to hide from predators. Of all existing insects, only dragonflies and mayflies are unable to fold their wings.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Secondo molti paleontologi di oggi una categoria di dinosauri è sopravvissuta ed è ancora viva. Sono quelli che chiamiamo uccelli. Molti tendono a non considerarli dinosauri a causa delle piume e della loro capacità di volare. Eppure gli uccelli hanno molte caratteristiche che li accomunano ai dinosauri. Come il T-Rex, sono dotati di piedi con squame e artigli, depongono le uova e camminano sulle due zampe posteriori.
mt: Many paleontologists believe that a category of dinosaurs has survived and is still alive. They are the ones we call birds. Many tend not to consider them dinosaurs because of the feathers and their ability to fly. Yet birds have many characteristics that link them to dinosaurs. Like the T-Rex, they have feet with scales and claws, lay eggs and walk on two hind legs.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: I denti del triceratopo erano in grado di frantumare non solo le foglie, ma anche i rami e le radici più resistenti. Secondo alcuni scienziati, il Triceratopo si nutriva di cicadee, una specie di pianta comune nel periodo Cretaceo. Queste piante assomigliano a una piccola palma e hanno una sorta di corona di foglie appuntite e acuminate. Con il suo robusto becco, un triceratopo poteva strappare via le foglie e poi mangiarsi il tronco. Secondo altri scienziati queste piante sono molto velenose, per cui è improbabile che i dinosauri le mangiassero, sebbene oggi il bradipo e altri animali come il pappagallo (che discende dai dinosauri) siano in grado di mangiare foglie o frutti velenosi.
mt: The triceratops' teeth were capable of crushing not only leaves, but also branches and roots. According to some scientists, the Triceratops ate cycads, a common plant in the Cretaceous period. These plants resemble a small palm and have a sort of crown of pointed and sharp leaves. With its robust beak, a triceratops could tear off the leaves and then eat the trunk. According to other scientists these plants are very poisonous, so it is unlikely that the dinosaurs ate them, although today the sloth and other animals such as the parrot (which descends from the dinosaurs) are able to eat poisonous leaves or fruits.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Nonostante il Lussemburgo abbia una lunga storia, ha raggiunto l'indipendenza nel 1839. Parti dell'attuale Belgio appartenevano in passato al Lussemburgo, ma sono diventate belghe dopo la Rivoluzione Belga del 1830. Nonostante il Lussemburgo abbia sempre cercato di restare neutrale, la Germania l'ha occupato sia durante la prima che durante la seconda guerra mondiale. Nel 1957 il Lussemburgo è stato uno dei Paesi fondatori dell'organizzazione oggi conosciuta come Unione europea.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history, but only gained independence in 1839. Parts of the current Belgium were once part of Luxembourg, but became Belgian after the Belgian Revolution of 1830. Despite Luxembourg's attempts to remain neutral, it was occupied by Germany during both World Wars. In 1957, Luxembourg was one of the founding countries of the organization now known as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Il 3% del Paese è costituito dalla Turchia europea (Tracia orientale o Rumelia nella penisola dei Balcani). Il territorio della Turchia si estende per oltre 1.600 km (1.000 miglia) di lunghezza e 800 km (500 miglia) di larghezza, con una forma più o meno rettangolare. La Turchia, inclusi i laghi, ha una superficie di 783.562 km² (300.948 miglia quadrate): di questi, 755.688 km² (291.773 miglia quadrate) situati nell'Asia sud-occidentale, e 23.764 km² (9.174 miglia quadrate) in Europa. La Turchia è per estensione il 37° Paese più grande del mondo; le sue dimensioni equivalgono approssimativamente alle dimensioni della Francia metropolitana e del Regno Unito insieme. La Turchia si affaccia al mare su tre lati: a ovest sul Mar Egeo, a nord sul Mar Nero e a sud sul Mar Mediterraneo.
mt: 3% of the country is the European Turkey (Eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan Peninsula). The territory of Turkey extends over 1,600 km (1,000 miles) in length and 800 km (500 miles) in width, with a more or less rectangular shape. Turkey, including lakes, has an area of 783,562 km² (300,948 square miles): of these, 755,688 km² (291,773 square miles) located in southwestern Asia, and 23,764 km² (9,174 square miles) in Europe. Turkey is by area the 37th largest country in the world; its dimensions are approximately equal to the dimensions of metropolitan France and the United Kingdom together. Turkey faces the sea on three sides: west on the Aegean Sea, north on the Black Sea and south on the Mediterranean Sea.

src: Quasi tutte le case nelle città di Harappa e Mohenjo-daro disponevano di un bagno con acqua corrente dotato di un collegamento a un avanzato sistema fognario. In Grecia, nelle abitazioni delle città minoiche di Creta e Santorini sono stati scoperti resti di reti fognarie. I gabinetti nell'antichità esistevano anche in Egitto, in Persia e in Cina. Nella civiltà romana erano talvolta inseriti nei bagni pubblici, frequentati da un pubblico misto di uomini e donne.
mt: Almost all houses in the cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a running water bathroom connected to an advanced sewer system. In Greece, in the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini, remains of sewer systems were found. Toilets in antiquity also existed in Egypt, Persia and China. In the Roman civilization they were sometimes inserted in public baths, frequented by a mixed public of men and women.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: La lama dei moderni pattini da ghiaccio presenta due bordi con una cavità concava tra loro. Il doppio bordo garantisce una migliore presa sul ghiaccio, anche quando sono inclinati. Il fondo della lama è leggermente curvo e quindi, quando la lama si piega da una parte o dall'altra, anche il filo che è a contatto con il ghiaccio descrive una curva. Ed è questo che consente al pattinatore di curvare. Se inclina i pattini a destra, il pattinatore curva a destra, se inclina i pattini a sinistra, il pattinatore curva a sinistra.
mt: The blade of modern ice skates has two edges with a concave cavity between them. The double edge provides a better grip on the ice, even when they are tilted. The bottom of the blade is slightly curved and therefore, when the blade bends to one side or the other, the edge that is in contact with the ice also describes a curve. And this is what allows the skater to curve. If the skater tilts the skates to the right, the skater curves to the right, if the skater tilts the skates to the left, the skater curves to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: "Per tornare al livello precedente di energia, devono liberarsi di quella in eccesso ottenuta dalla luce. Per farlo, emettono una piccolissima particella di luce, chiamata ""fotone"". Questo processo è definito dagli scienziati ""emissione stimolata di radiazione""; infatti, gli atomi vengono stimolati da un fascio di luce intensa che provoca l'emissione di un fotone di luce e la luce è un tipo di radiazione. Nella seguente immagine vengono mostrati gli atomi che emettono fotoni. Ovviamente, nella realtà, le dimensioni dei fotoni sono molto inferiori a come illustrato in foto. I fotoni sono ancora più piccoli della materia che costituisce gli atomi!"
mt: "To return to the previous level of energy, they must get rid of the excess energy obtained from light. To do this, they emit a tiny particle of light, called a ""photon"". This process is called by scientists ""stimulated emission of radiation""; in fact, the atoms are stimulated by a bright beam of light that causes the emission of a photon of light and light is a type of radiation. In the following image, the atoms that emit photons are shown. Of course, in reality, the dimensions of the photons are much smaller than as illustrated in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the matter that constitutes the atoms!"
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Dopo aver funzionato per centinaia di ore, alla fine il filamento del bulbo si brucia e la lampadina smette di funzionare. La lampadina deve essere sostituita. È necessario prestare attenzione quando lo si fa. Prima di tutto, è necessario spegnere l'interruttore della lampada, oppure scollegare il cavo. Questo per il rischio di scossa elettrica, provocata dall'elettricità che passa nella presa in cui è inserita la parte metallica del bulbo, nel caso in cui si tocchi l'interno della presa o la base in metallo del bulbo, se ancora parzialmente inserito nella presa.
mt: After working for hundreds of hours, eventually the filament of the bulb burns out and the light bulb stops working. The light bulb must be replaced. It is important to be careful when doing so. First, it is necessary to turn off the light switch, or unplug the cord. This is to avoid electric shock, caused by electricity that passes through the socket in which the metal part of the bulb is inserted, in the case where one touches the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb, if still partially inserted into the socket.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Il principio secondo cui è necessaria energia per mettere insieme un nucleo con molti protoni e neutroni è alla base del funzionamento della bomba a fissione. In pratica è come far rotolare un pesante carrello su una collina. Quindi, suddividendo ulteriormente il nucleo, una parte di quell'energia viene rilasciata. Alcuni atomi presentano nuclei instabili, questo vuol dire che tendono a rompersi in presenza di una spinta scarsa o nulla.
mt: The principle that energy is needed to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons is the basis of the functioning of the fission bomb. In practice it is like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. So, by further subdividing the nucleus, a part of that energy is released. Some atoms have unstable nuclei, this means that they tend to break in the presence of a small or no push.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Per telefonare a qualcuno lontano migliaia di miglia, si utilizza un satellite. Il satellite nello spazio riceve il segnale e poi lo rimanda indietro quasi all'istante. Il lancio del satellite nello spazio è stato effettuato con un razzo. Gli scienziati ricorrono ai telescopi spaziali perché l'atmosfera della Terra distorce in parte la luce e la visuale. Per trasportare nello spazio un satellite o un telescopio è necessario un razzo alto più di 100 piedi.
mt: To call someone thousands of miles away, you use a satellite. The satellite in space receives the signal and then sends it back almost instantly. The launch of the satellite into space was done with a rocket. Scientists use space telescopes because the atmosphere of the Earth distorts the light and the view in part. To transport a satellite or a telescope into space, you need a rocket that is more than 100 feet tall.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Il tempo è qualcosa che ci circonda e influenza ogni nostra azione, ma è difficile da comprendere. Il tempo è oggetto di studio di eruditi religiosi, filosofi e scienziati da migliaia di anni. Percepiamo il tempo come una serie di eventi che dal futuro passano al passato attraverso il presente. Il tempo è inoltre l'unità di misura con cui confrontiamo la durata (lunghezza) degli eventi. Ognuno di noi può scandire lo scorrere del tempo osservando la ripetizione di un evento ciclico, che è qualcosa che si ripete sistematicamente.
mt: Time is something that surrounds us and influences every action, but it is difficult to understand. Time is the subject of study of religious scholars, philosophers and scientists for thousands of years. We perceive time as a series of events that from the future pass to the past through the present. Time is also the unit of measure with which we compare the duration (length) of events. Each of us can measure the passage of time by observing the repetition of a cyclic event, which is something that systematically repeats itself.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: "Tradizionalmente, al termine del percorso scolastico l'erede al trono raggiungeva direttamente l'esercito. Charles invece frequentò il Trinity College a Cambridge, dove studiò antropologia, archeologia e, in un secondo momento, storia, conseguendo un 2:2 (classe di voto ""Lower Second Class""). Carlo è il primo membro della famiglia reale britannica che abbia conseguito una laurea."
mt: "Traditionally, at the end of the school course the heir to the throne joined the army directly. Charles instead attended the Trinity College at Cambridge, where he studied anthropology, archaeology and, later, history, earning a 2:2 (class of vote ""Lower Second Class""). Charles is the first member of the British royal family to have earned a degree."
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: Un lungo periodo di pace per l'Inghilterra era seguito alla riconquista del Danelaw. Tuttavia, nel 991 Ethelred si trovò ad affrontare una flotta vichinga più grande di qualsiasi altra dai tempi di Guthrum un secolo prima. A capo della flotta c'era Olaf Trygvasson, un norvegese animato dall'ambizione di riprendersi il proprio Paese sottraendolo ai dominatori danesi. Dopo un inizio militare disastroso, Etelredo venne a patti con Olaf, che ritornò in Norvegia per cercare di conquistare il suo regno, con successi alterni.
mt: 991 was a year of peace for England after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However, in 991 Ethelred found himself facing a Viking fleet larger than any since the time of Guthrum a century before. At its head was Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian driven by ambition to retake his country from the Danish overlords. After a disastrous start, Ethelred made peace with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to conquer his kingdom, with mixed success.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: "Intorno al XV secolo, il nord dell'Estonia era esposto a una forte influenza culturale da parte della Germania. Per avvicinare Dio al popolo indigeno, alcuni monaci tedeschi hanno inventato la lingua letteraria estone. Aveva come base l'alfabeto tedesco, con l'aggiunta del carattere ""Õ/õ"". Nel tempo, vennero integrate molte parole prese in prestito dal tedesco. Fu l'inizio di un periodo di ispirazione."
mt: "Around the 15th century, the north of Estonia was exposed to a strong cultural influence from Germany. To bring God to the indigenous people, some German monks invented the Estonian literary language. It was based on the German alphabet, with the addition of the character ""Õ/õ"". Over time, many words were borrowed from German. It was the beginning of an inspirational period."
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Ci sono varie stime del numero di persone che parlano hindi. Si calcola che sia tra la seconda e la quarta lingua con più parlanti al mondo. Il numero di parlanti madrelingua varia a seconda che i dialetti strettamente collegati tra loro siano o meno inclusi nel conto. Le stime oscillano da 340 milioni a 500 milioni di persone che parlano la lingua, e fino a 800 milioni di persone in grado di comprenderla. src: Esistono molte teorie sulle origini del sanscrito. Una le fa risalire agli Arii, che migrando dall'occidente in India avrebbero portato con loro la propria lingua. Il sanscrito è una lingua classica ed è paragonabile al latino parlato in Europa. Il primo libro al mondo di cui si ha conoscenza fu scritto in sanscrito. Dopo la composizione delle Upanishad, il sanscrito perdette di importanza. Il sanscrito è una lingua decisamente ricca e complessa che ha dato origine a molte delle lingue indiane moderne, così come il latino è all'origine di alcune lingue europee, come il francese e lo spagnolo.
mt: There are many theories on the origins of Sanskrit. One makes it descend from the Aryans, who migrated from the west to India and brought their language with them. Sanskrit is a classical language and is comparable to Latin spoken in Europe. The first book in the world known to have been written in Sanskrit. After the composition of the Upanishads, Sanskrit lost its importance. Sanskrit is a decidedly rich and complex language that has given rise to many of the modern Indian languages, just as Latin is the origin of some European languages, such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Che effetto avrebbe su di me la forza di gravità di Io? Se fossimo sulla superficie di Io, peseremmo di meno che sulla Terra. Una persona che sulla Terra pesa 200 libbre (90 kg), su Io peserebbe all'incirca 36 libbre (16 kg). La forza di gravità, pertanto, esercita su di noi una pressione inferiore.
mt: What would the gravity of Io feel like to me? If we were on the surface of Io, we would weigh less than on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90 kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16 kg) on Io. Gravity, therefore, exerts less pressure on us.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: La superficie della Luna è costituita da rocce e polvere e il suo strato esterno si chiama crosta. La crosta ha uno spessore di circa 70 km nel lato più vicino e di 100 km sul lato più lontano. È più sottile sotto i mari e più spessa sotto le aree montuose. I maria potrebbero essere più numerosi sul lato vicino perché la crosta è più sottile. Ciò ha facilitato la risalita della lava in superficie.
mt: The Moon's surface is made up of rocks and dust and its outer layer is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the seas and thicker under the mountainous areas. The seas may be more numerous on the near side because the crust is thinner. This has facilitated the rise of lava to the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: "Molte persone fantasticano sul giorno in cui gli esseri umani potranno viaggiare verso un altro astro ed esplorare nuovi mondi, alcuni si chiedono cosa c’è là fuori, altri pensano che su altri pianeti possano vivere alieni o altre forme di vita. Ma, qualora ciò dovesse mai accadere, probabilmente non accadrà per un periodo di tempo molto lungo. Le stelle sono così disseminate che ci sono miliardi di chilometri tra le stelle che risultano essere ""vicine"". Chissà se un giorno i vostri pronipoti si troveranno su un mondo alieno e penseranno ai loro antichi antenati!"
mt: "Many people fantasize about the day when humans can travel to another star and explore new worlds, some wonder what's out there, others think there may be aliens or other life forms on other planets. But if this were to ever happen, it would not happen for a very long time. Stars are so dispersed that there are billions of kilometers between the stars that are ""close"". Who knows if one day your great-grandchildren will be on an alien world and think of their ancient ancestors!"

Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: "Il Sole, diversamente dalla Terra, non ha una crosta su cui poggiarsi. L'intero Sole è formato da gas, fuoco e plasma. Il gas diventa meno denso quanto più ci si allontana dal centro del Sole. La superficie esterna visibile del Sole è detta fotosfera, ovvero ""sfera di luce""."
mt: "The Sun, unlike the Earth, does not have a crust to stand on. The entire Sun is made of gas, fire and plasma. The gas becomes less dense the further away from the center of the Sun. The visible outer surface of the Sun is called the photosphere, or ""sphere of light."""
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Circa tremila anni più tardi, nel 1610, l'astronomo italiano Galileo Galilei, osservando Venere con un telescopio, vide che il pianeta presentava delle fasi, analoghe a quelle della Luna. Le fasi si verificano perché solo la faccia di Venere (o della Luna) rivolta verso il Sole viene illuminata. Le fasi venusiane avvalorarono la teoria di Copernico secondo cui i pianeti ruotano intorno al Sole. Nel 1639, alcuni anni dopo, l'astronomo inglese Jeremiah Horrocks osservò un transito di Venere.
mt: 3,000 years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei, observing Venus with a telescope, saw that the planet had phases, like the Moon. The phases occur because only the side of Venus (or the Moon) facing the Sun is illuminated. Venusian phases supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets revolve around the Sun. In 1639, a few years later, English astronomer Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Il Rio delle Amazzoni è il fiume più grande e il secondo più lungo della Terra. Trasporta una quantità d'acqua pari a 8 volte quella del secondo fiume più grande. Il Rio delle Amazzoni è anche il fiume più largo della Terra, con una larghezza che in alcuni punti arriva a sei miglia. Il 20% totale dell'acqua che dai fiumi del pianeta si riversa negli oceani proviene dal Rio delle Amazzoni. Il fiume Rio delle Amazzoni principale è lungo 6.387 km (3.980 miglia). In esso si riversano le acque di migliaia di affluenti minori.
mt: The Amazon River is the largest and second longest river in the world. It carries a volume of water eight times that of the second largest river. The Amazon River is also the widest river in the world, with a width in some places of six miles. Twenty percent of the total water that flows from the rivers of the planet into the oceans comes from the Amazon River. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles) long. It drains the waters of thousands of smaller tributaries.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Le stelle irradiano luce e calore per via dell'energia che si sprigiona quando gli atomi di idrogeno si uniscono (o si fondono) tra loro, formando elementi più pesanti. Gli scienziati sono al lavoro per creare un reattore che produca energia nello stesso modo. Si tratta comunque di una questione molto complessa da risolvere e dovranno trascorrere molti anni prima di arrivare alla realizzazione di reattori a fusione efficaci.
mt: Stars emit light and heat by releasing energy when hydrogen atoms fuse together (or combine) to form heavier elements. Scientists are working on creating a reactor that produces energy in the same way. However, this is a very complex issue to solve and it will take many years before we can have effective fusion reactors.

Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Elementi e composti hanno la capacità di passare da uno stato all'altro senza subire modifiche. L'azoto in forma gassosa conserva le stesse proprietà dell'azoto liquido. La densità dello stato liquido è maggiore, ma le molecole restano uguali. Un altro esempio è l'acqua. Il composto acqua è costituito da due atomi di idrogeno e uno di ossigeno. Ha la stessa struttura molecolare, sia allo stato gassoso che a quello liquido o solido. Anche se il suo stato fisico può cambiare, lo stato chimico rimane invariato.
mt: Elements and compounds have the ability to pass from one state to another without undergoing changes. Gaseous nitrogen retains the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state has a higher density, but the molecules remain the same. Another example is water. The water compound is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure, whether in the gaseous, liquid, or solid state. Although its physical state can change, its chemical state remains unchanged.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Durante la guerra d’indipendenza, i tredici stati formarono per la prima volta un governo centrale debole, e il Congresso ne fu l’unico componente, secondo lo Statuto della Confederazione. Il Congresso non aveva alcun potere di imporre tasse e, data l'assenza di un potere esecutivo o giudiziario a livello nazionale, si affidava alle autorità statali, spesso poco collaborative, per l'applicazione dei propri atti. Non aveva nemmeno l'autorità di bypassare le leggi fiscali e i dazi tra gli stati. Per modificare gli articoli era necessario il consenso unanime di tutti gli stati. Questi per parte loro avevano così poca considerazione del governo centrale che i loro rappresentanti erano spesso assenti.
mt: During the War of Independence, the thirteen states formed a weak central government for the first time, and the Congress was the only component, according to the Confederation Statute. The Congress had no power to impose taxes and, given the absence of a national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, often uncooperative, for the implementation of its acts. It also lacked the authority to bypass state tax and tariff laws. To amend the articles, unanimous consent of all states was required. These in turn had so little regard for the central government that their representatives were often absent.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

Questi per parte loro avevano così poca considerazione del governo centrale che i loro rappresentanti erano spesso assenti.
mt: During the War of Independence, the thirteen states formed a weak central government for the first time, and the Congress was the only component, according to the Confederation Statute. The Congress had no power to impose taxes and, given the absence of a national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, often uncooperative, for the implementation of its acts. It also lacked the authority to bypass state tax and tariff laws. To amend the articles, unanimous consent of all states was required. These in turn had so little regard for the central government that their representatives were often absent.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: "Se avete visto il film ""Il mistero dei Templari"", potreste pensare che sul retro della Dichiarazione d'Indipendenza sia disegnata una mappa del tesoro. Comunque, questo è falso. Anche se sul retro del documento c'è scritto qualcosa, non si tratta di una mappa del tesoro. Sul retro della Dichiarazione di indipendenza si trova la scritta ""Dichiarazione di indipendenza originale del 4 luglio 1776"". Il testo compare capovolto in fondo al documento. Nonostante non si sappia per certo chi lo ha scritto, è risaputo che all'inizio della sua esistenza l'ampio documento di pergamena (misura 29,75 pollici per 24,5 pollici) sia stato arrotolato per essere riposto. Probabilmente, quindi, l'annotazione è stata apposta solo come un'etichetta."
mt: "If you've seen the movie "The Da Vinci Code," you might think that the back of the Declaration of Independence is a map to the treasure. However, this is false. Although there is writing on the back of the document, it is not a map to the treasure. On the back of the Declaration of Independence is the inscription "Original Declaration of Independence, July 4, 1776." The text appears upside down at the bottom of the document. Although it is not known for certain who wrote it, it is known that at the beginning of its existence the large parchment document (29.75 inches by 24.5 inches) was rolled up to be stored. Probably, therefore, the annotation was only added as a label."
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: Nei primi anni dell’indipendenza della nazione, l’esperienza dei Giardini Botanici di Singapore ha determinato la trasformazione dell’isola in una città-giardino tropicale. Nel 1981 l'ibrido di orchidea Vanda Miss Joaquim è stato scelto come fiore nazionale del Paese.
mt: In the early years of the nation's independence, the experience of the Singapore Botanic Gardens has transformed the island into a tropical garden city. In 1981 the orchid hybrid Vanda Miss Joaquim was chosen as the national flower of the country.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Si continuarono a costruire piramidi in pietra fino al termine dell'Antico Regno, ma nonostante questo le piramidi di Giza non furono mai superate in termini di grandezza e eccellenza tecnica della loro realizzazione. Gli antichi egizi del Nuovo Regno rimanevano incantanti ammirando i monumenti dei loro antenati, che a quel tempo avevano molto più di mille anni.
mt: Pyrnids were still being built in stone until the end of the Old Kingdom, but despite this, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in terms of size and excellence of their construction. The ancient Egyptians of the New Kingdom remained awestruck by the monuments of their ancestors, which at that time had more than a thousand years.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Tutti gli anni, verso il mese di ottobre, quasi 1,5 milioni di erbivori migrano dalle colline settentrionali alle pianure meridionali, attraverso il fiume Mara, a causa delle piogge. Poi ancora a nord passando per l'ovest, attraversando nuovamente il fiume Mara, a seguito delle piogge intorno al mese di aprile. La regione del Serengeti accoglie il Serengeti National Park, la Ngorongoro Conservation Area e la Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania e la Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
mt: 1.5 million herbivores migrate annually from the northern hills to the southern plains, across the Mara River, due to the rains. Then again to the north passing through the west, crossing the Mara River again, following the rains around the month of April. The Serengeti region includes the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and the Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: "Dopo aver sconfitto la Francia, la Germania iniziò a prepararsi per l'invasione della Gran Bretagna. L'attacco è stato chiamato in codice ""Operazione Sealion"" dalla Germania. L'esercito britannico si trovava in una condizione di fragilità poiché la maggior parte delle sue armi pesanti e dei suoi rifornimenti era andata persa durante l'evacuazione di Dunkerque. Tuttavia, la Royal Navy rimaneva ancora molto più potente della Marina militare tedesca (""Kriegsmarine"") e avrebbe potuto distruggere qualunque flotta inviata per invadere attraverso la Manica. Ciononostante, le navi della Royal Navy stanziate nelle vicinanze delle possibili rotte di conquista erano molto poche: gli ammiragli, infatti, temevano che sarebbero state affondate dall'attacco aereo tedesco."
mt: "After defeating France, Germany began preparing for the invasion of Great Britain. The attack was called in code ""Operation Sealion"" by Germany. The British Army was in a state of fragility because most of its heavy weapons and supplies were lost during the evacuation of Dunkirk. However, the Royal Navy remained much more powerful than the German Navy (""Kriegsmarine"") and could have destroyed any fleet sent to invade across the Channel. Nevertheless, the ships of the Royal Navy stationed near the possible routes of conquest were very few: the admirals, in fact, feared that they would be sunk by the German air attack."
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: "Iniziamo analizzando quali erano i piani dell'Italia. L'Italia era essenzialmente la ""sorella minore"" di Germania e Giappone. Avevano un esercito e una marina più deboli, anche se avevano costruito quattro nuove imbarcazioni poco prima dell'inizio della guerra. Gli obiettivi principali dell'Italia erano i Paesi africani. Per conquistare quei Paesi, sarebbe stato necessario avere una base di partenza per le truppe per consentire loro di attraversare il Mar Mediterraneo e invadere l'Africa. Perciò dovettero sbarazzarsi delle basi e delle navi britanniche in Egitto. A parte questo, non era previsto che le navi da guerra italiane facessero altro. Ora veniamo al Giappone, che era uno Stato insulare, proprio come la Gran Bretagna."
mt: "Let's start by analyzing what Italy's plans were. Italy was essentially the "younger sister" of Germany and Japan. They had a weaker army and navy, even though they had built four new ships just before the start of the war. Italy's main objectives were the African countries. To conquer those countries, they would need a base of operations for their troops to allow them to cross the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. Therefore, they had to get rid of the British bases and ships in Egypt. Apart from that, the Italian warships were not expected to do anything else. Now let's come to Japan, which was an island nation, just like Great Britain."
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."

src: "Gli sbarchi del D-Day e gli scontri che ne seguirono avevano portato il nord della Francia alla liberazione, ma il sud era ancora occupato. Era governato dal regime di Vichy, ovvero da quei francesi che nel 1940 avevano fatto pace con i tedeschi e si erano alleati con gli invasori, invece di combatterli. Il 15 agosto 1940 gli Alleati invasero la Francia del sud: questa azione offensiva prese il nome di ""Operazione Dragoon"". Le forze americane e quelle dei Francesi Liberi avevano liberato il sud della Francia in appena due settimane e si dirigevano verso la Germania."
mt: "The D-Day landings and the battles that followed had brought northern France to liberation, but the south was still occupied. It was governed by the Vichy regime, that is, by those French who in 1940 had made peace with the Germans and allied themselves with the invaders, instead of fighting them. On August 15, 1940, the Allies invaded southern France: this offensive operation was called ""Operation Dragoon"". American and Free French forces had liberated southern France in just two weeks and were heading towards Germany."
ref: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."

src: I sottomarini sono imbarcazioni progettate per spostarsi e rimanere sott'acqua per lunghi periodi di tempo. I sottomarini furono utilizzati nella prima e nella seconda guerra mondiale. A quel tempo erano molto lenti e avevano una portata di tiro assai limitata. All'inizio della guerra viaggiavano soprattutto in superficie, ma in seguito allo sviluppo del radar e alla sua maggiore precisione, i sottomarini dovettero andare sott'acqua per evitare di essere visti. I sottomarini tedeschi venivano chiamati U-Boot. I tedeschi erano molto abili nel guidarli e manovrarli. Dopo la guerra, considerato il loro successo con questi mezzi navali, i tedeschi sono ritenuti pericolosi nel caso ne avessero posseduti un gran numero.
mt: Submarines are designed to move and stay underwater for long periods of time. Submarines were used in the first and second world war. At that time they were very slow and had a very limited range. At the beginning of the war they mostly traveled on the surface, but after the development of radar and its greater accuracy, submarines had to go underwater to avoid being seen. German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at guiding and maneuvering them. After the war, considering their success with these naval vessels, the Germans are considered dangerous if they had a large number of them.
ref: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range. In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines. Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.

src: Il 17 settembre 1939, la difesa polacca era già stata sfondata; l'unica opzione era battere in ritirata e riorganizzarsi lungo la testa di ponte romena. Questi piani si dimostrarono tuttavia subito obsoleti, nel momento in cui più di 800.000 soldati dell'Armata Rossa sovietica avanzarono e crearono i fronti bielorusso e ucraino, dopo aver invaso le regioni orientali della Polonia, violando il trattato di pace di Riga, il patto di non aggressione sovietico-polacco e altri trattati internazionali, bilaterali e multilaterali.
mt: 17 September 1939, the Polish defense had already been broken; the only option was to retreat and reorganize along the Romanian bridgehead. These plans proved obsolete, however, when more than 800,000 soldiers of the Soviet Red Army advanced and created the Belorussian and Ukrainian fronts, after invading the eastern regions of Poland, violating the Treaty of Riga, the Soviet-Polish non-aggression pact and other international, bilateral and multilateral treaties.
ref: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead. However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.

src: Fin quasi dall'inizio, le cose non sono andate bene per gli italiani in Nord Africa. A meno di una settimana dalla dichiarazione di guerra dell'Italia avvenuta il 10 giugno 1940, i britannici dell'11º Reggimento Ussari conquistarono il Forte Capuzzo in Libia. Gli inglesi catturarono il generale Lastucci, comandante del Genio militare della 10ª Armata italiana tendendogli un'imboscata a est di Bardia. Il 28 giugno fu il fuoco amico a uccidere il maresciallo Italo Balbo, governatore generale della Libia e probabile erede di Mussolini, durante lo sbarco a Tobruk.
mt: From almost the beginning, things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa. Less than a week after Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars captured the Fort Capuzzo in Libya. The British captured General Lastucci, commander of the Military Engineering of the 10th Italian Army, ambushing him east of Bardia. On June 28, friendly fire killed Marshal Italo Balbo, Governor General of Libya and probable heir to Mussolini, during the landing at Tobruk.
ref: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya. In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci. On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.

src: Il buddismo tibetano è basato sugli insegnamenti del Buddha, ma è stato arricchito dal percorso d'amore del rito mahayano e da svariate tecniche dello yoga indiano. In linea di massima, il buddismo tibetano è molto semplice. Ha fondamento nel Kundalini Yoga, nella meditazione e in un percorso di amore omnicomprensivo. Il Kundalini Yoga attiva l'energia Kundalini (energia dell'illuminazione) mediante l'impiego di posizioni yoga, esercizi di respirazione, mantra e visualizzazioni. Il Deity Yoga è il fulcro della meditazione tibetana. Mediante la raffigurazione di varie divinità si puliscono i canali energetici, si attivano i chakra e si sviluppa la coscienza dell’illuminazione.
mt: Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of the Buddha, but has been enriched by the path of love of the Mahayana rite and various techniques of Indian yoga. In general, Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It has its foundation in Kundalini Yoga, meditation and an all-encompassing path of love. Kundalini Yoga activates the Kundalini energy (energy of enlightenment) through the use of yoga positions, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations. Deity Yoga is the core of Tibetan meditation. By depicting various deities, the energy channels are cleansed, the chakras are activated and the consciousness of enlightenment is developed.
ref: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga. In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love. With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations. The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.

src: "I festeggiamenti sono iniziati con un'esibizione straordinaria della celebre compagnia Cirque du Soleil. A seguire, si sono esibiti l'Orchestra Sinfonica di Stato di Istanbul, una banda di giannizzeri e i cantanti Fatih Erkoç e Müslüm Gürses. Quindi sono saliti sul palco i dervisci danzanti. La star turca Sezen Aksu si è esibita insieme ad Alessandro Safina, tenore italiano, e a Haris Alexiou, cantante greca. infine, la compagnia di danza turca Fire of Anatolia ha interpretato la performance ""Troy""."
mt: "The celebrations began with an extraordinary performance by the famous Cirque du Soleil. Then, the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, a band of janissaries and singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses took the stage. Then, the whirling dervishes performed. Turkish star Sezen Aksu performed with Italian tenor Alessandro Safina and Greek singer Haris Alexiou. Finally, the Turkish dance company Fire of Anatolia performed the show ""Troy""."
ref: "The celebrations started with a special show by the world-renowned group Cirque du Soleil. It was followed by the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, a Janissary band, and the singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses. Then Whirling Dervishes took to the stage. Turkish diva Sezen Aksu performed with the Italian tenor Alessandro Safina and Greek singer Haris Alexiou. To finish, Turkish dance group Fire of Anatolia performed the show ""Troy""."

src: "Durante l'attesa, con temperature pari a 90 °F, ai passeggeri è stata offerta dell'acqua. Il Capitano dei vigili del fuoco Scott Kouns ha dichiarato: ""A Santa Clara è stata una giornata calda e le temperature si sono aggirate sui 90 gradi. Passare un qualsiasi periodo di tempo intrappolati sulle montagne russe è a dir poco sgradevole, e per far scendere la prima persona dalla giostra è servita un'ora almeno""."
mt: "During the wait, with temperatures of 90 °F, passengers were offered water. Santa Clara Fire Captain Scott Kouns said, ""It was a hot day in Santa Clara, and the temperatures were in the 90s. Any time spent trapped on the roller coaster is less than pleasant, and it took at least an hour to get the first person off the ride.""

Any length of time trapped on a roller coaster would be uncomfortable, to say the least, and it took at least an hour to get the first person off the ride."""

src: Secondo l'ultimo bollettino, le letture del livello del mare hanno segnalato la generazione di uno tsunami. Vicino a Pago Pago e Niue è stata registrata un'attività riconducibile a quella di uno tsunami. Non sono stati segnalati danni a cose o persone a Tonga, tuttavia è mancata temporaneamente la corrente elettrica e questo, stando a quanto riportato, non ha permesso alle autorità tongane di ricevere l'allerta tsunami dal PTWC. Quattordici scuole delle Hawaii situate in prossimità dei litorali sono rimaste chiuse per tutta la giornata di mercoledì nonostante gli allarmi fossero rientrati.
mt: According to the latest bulletin, sea level readings have indicated the generation of a tsunami. Near Pago Pago and Niue, activity was reported as being related to a tsunami. No damage to property or persons has been reported in Tonga, however, power was out for a time, which prevented Tongan authorities from receiving the tsunami warning from the PTWC. Fourteen schools in Hawaii near the coast were closed for the entire day on Wednesday, despite the all-clear.
ref: According to the latest bulletin, sea level readings indicated a tsunami was generated. There was some definite tsunami activity recorded near Pago Pago and Niue. No major damage or injuries have been reported in Tonga, but power was temporarily lost, which reportedly prevented Tongan authorities from receiving the tsunami warning issued by the PTWC. Fourteen schools in Hawaii located on or near coastlines were closed all of Wednesday despite the warnings being lifted.
